name: Giant Tribes
background:
The Giant Tribes are made up of massive humanoids who vary in size from simply giant to gargantuan. Often employed as mercenaries, Giants rely on their strength and durability to make up for their lack of numbers.

Giants are usually created through magical means, and many tribes trace their origin to the Havoc Wars, where the Empire used this magic extensively. As the wars ended, most Giants were cast out of human lands, with the survivors forming into tribes, where they work together to adapt to their new lives.
backgroundFull:
Ogre Alchemists first developed magic which allowed creatures to grow to gigantic sizes using potions. Gradually, these Ogre Alchemists fell out of favour and were displaced from the royal courts of their homeland. The Alchemists and their followers left their homelands in massive caravans, travelling further east in search of a better life. 

Even after the Alchemists and their knowledge died out, early Giants persisted in legends throughout the Great Steppes and beyond. However, over centuries, lost alchemical potions would be discovered in crypts and caches throughout the Steppe. These potions were sought out and studied by the Wizarding Guild of the Empire, who hoped to recreate the magic themselves. 

‍

At first, the study and use of these potions were slow and controlled, but this changed when the Havoc Wars began. The Empire recruited wizards to use this magic in order to create giant warriors who could fight Greater Daemons. In the beginning, the volunteers were chosen from veterans with proven skill and valour. As the war dragged on, however, the Empire took anyone willing to volunteer. Then, when the Empire’s most powerful wizards sacrificed themselves to seal Havoc, the Giants were left without a means of returning to their former size. 

Too large to return to their old home, most Giants were left to fend for themselves. Some Giants, bitter about their situation, turned to extorting or robbing villages. This quickly led to towns viewing Giants with fear and hatred and made them a target for questing knights, so most Giants began to move away from the cities of the Empire towards the Great Steppes. 

Giant Tribes often seek out friendships and alliances with other species who can help keep them fed and supply them with cloth and other goods. It is said that if Giants see potential in someone, they may even offer them some of these ancient potions, allowing them to join their ranks. The Giants have only a limited supply of these potions, however, and are constantly seeking more. 

How will you carve out a place for your tribe?

spells.name: Aura of Heroism
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets +1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? this.getMoraleCost({ ...unit, quality: Math.max(1, unit.quality - params.effect.rollModifier.value) }) - this.getMoraleCost(unit) : 0

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Fire Ball
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hit with AP(1) and Surge. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spells.name: Magic Targeting
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units get +1 to hit rolls in melee against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value:
var range = params.effect.attackType?.value ?? 24;
return (this.getWeaponCost({ attacks: 1.5, range }, { quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getWeaponCost({ attacks: 1.5, range }, { quality: 5 }))

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Blood Hex
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 6 hit.

spells.name: Elemental Form
spells.effect: Pick up to three friendly units within 12", which get AP(+1) in melee once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)
once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Spirit Leech
spells.effect: Pick one enemy model within 18", which takes 6 hit with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Plaguebound
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Unmovable
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule is Shaken at the beginning of the round, roll one die. On a 4+, it stops being Shaken.

specialRules.name: Warbound
specialRules.description: Enemies that roll to block hits from this model's weapons take 1 extra wound for each unmodified result of 1 that they roll.

specialRules.name: Delayed Action
specialRules.description: Once per round, if your opponent has more units left to activate than you, then this model's unit may pass its turn instead of activating (may still be activated later).

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Changebound
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot or charged from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Lustbound
specialRules.description: Moves +1" when using Advance, and +3” when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).
